1.text: Put softened cream cheese and butter into a mixing bowl.

2.text: Beat or whisk the butter and cream cheese on high speed for 3 minutes.

3.text: Mix in powdered sugar, vanilla, and salt on low speed.

4.text: Turn the mixer to high and beat the frosting for 2 minutes.

5.text: Spread the cream cheese frosting on cake, cupcakes, or quick breads.

6.text: Put 1 1/2 cups (340 g) of butter into a bowl and sift the powdered sugar over it.

7.text: Beat the butter and powdered sugar on low for 30 seconds.

8.text: Mix in 2 teaspoons (9.9 ml) of vanilla extract and 3/4 teaspoon (3 g) of salt.

9.text: Beat the frosting on medium speed for 5 to 6 minutes.

10.text: Mix in 6 tablespoons (85 g) of heavy cream on low speed.

11.text: Spread the simple buttercream on cupcakes, cake, or cookies.

12.text: Chill a mixing bowl and whisk in the freezer for at least 15 minutes.

13.text: Remove the bowl and pour the cream, vanilla, and sugar into it.

14.text: Whip the ingredients on high speed for up to 1 minute.

15.text: Spoon the whipped cream frosting over pie, cake, or fresh fruit.
